programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers look for big bucks in Moreno Valley, Dave and Ivy fight over a pair of units and Maverick struggles to find a good unit at a fair price.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton Jones and Allen Haff try to make a profit by selling a 19th-century Colt Peacemaker pistol, a Depression-era slot machine and a customised mini-bike.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The traders discover a valuable 1970s Fender Stratocaster guitar and a rare Schwinn bicycle from the 1930s.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has to call security when an argument over a missing item turns violent, a high-stakes gambler visits the shop for funds and a customer tries to sell a gynaecologist's table.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les causes a stir when he tells a woman her gold bracelet is fake, and Seth later struggles to determine whether a watch is priceless or worthless.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: During an attempt to recover gold from the the RMS Republic, a panicking diver has an accident that puts his life in danger and threatens to shut the mission down.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: A team hunts a gator in a state park that has become a danger to the public, while the other swampers begin to lose focus in the pursuit of individual prey.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Howie faces a tough task when a cargo of lumber spills out across a busy motorway, while the Rotator faces its first real test in Northern Alberta.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys race to check out a motorbike once owned by The Great Escape actor Steve McQueen. They also encounter a rare shotgun disguised as a cane.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a first-edition copy of an Ernest Hemingway novel and a 1932 Lincoln Roadster, and discover the story behind an unusual belt-buckle.

programme.title: Jon Richardson: Ultimate Worrier
programme.desc: Jon and guests Josh Widdicombe, John Robins and Holly Walsh discuss, categorise and rank People worries. Are greetings getting out of hand? Are robots doing all our thinking?.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Extended edition from April 2016 in which comedian and actress Tracey Ullman became the 100th guest host of the satirical current affairs quiz, with broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles and BBC News presenter Clive Myrie joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at that week's news.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show in which the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the Christmas fun are former Test Match Special commentator Henry Blofeld, Witless star Kerry Howard, broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles and BBC News presenter Clive Myrie. They all reveal amazing stories, but are they telling the truth, or making it all up?.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: Judge Romesh dishes out justice for a rapper and a video producer locked in a bitter battle. Plus, a stark-naked accident has brought an ABBA tribute act to court.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: A wife brings her husband to court over his obsession with a 'classic' car. Plus, warring neighbours resort to drastic measures to settle their constant rowing.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian introduces popcorn to Munty, Barbara dreams of becoming one of the famous Munty Clack Dancers and Howell makes a truth potion for Slasher Morgan - with disastrous results.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber starts work on another O-level course, but wily old cellmate Fletcher can't understand why he doesn't just cheat in the exam. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch tries to ensure that Godber has not blown his chances of early release after he gets into a fight a week before his parole board hearing. Final episode of the classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson hikes up from Lyme Regis on Dorset's Jurassic Coast to the Somerset Levels in the footsteps of a ragtag rebel army led by the young Duke of Monmouth, the illegitimate son of Charles II. He sailed in from Holland around Lyme's famous Cobb with a handful of soldiers, believing the people would support him in overthrowing the newly crowned James II, who was also Monmouth's uncle, but, more importantly, Roman Catholic. The year was 1685 and the country was riven by anti-Catholic feeling mixed up with revolutionary zeal. Monmouth marched through the fiercely independent towns of Devon, gathering support from artisans and farmworkers. Meeting up with Billy Bragg in Colyton, Tony learns about the kind of people prepared to risk their lives for the Monmouth Rebellion.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The First Silent Night
programme.desc: Simon Callow discovers the origin of the Christmas carol and the story of the two Austrians who wrote it.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey profiles two of Britain's greatest wartime leaders. He begins by revealing how Winston Churchill came to write a biography of his ancestor John, who led the nation against Louis XIV of France. Starkey also explores how preparations for the Second World War were affected by the prime minister's knowledge of his 17th-century forebear's achievements.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates conflicting accounts of the killing of Italian dictator Benito Mussolini in 1945.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: A look at how British-trained Czechs were behind the assassination of Reinhard Heydrich, one of the main architects of the Holocaust.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Broughton Castle, near Banbury, Oxfordshire. Among the finds brought in to be valued are an art nouveau vase, a Georgian dolls' house, a Victorian baby bouncer, a letter from Lord Nelson, a book of early police mug shots, a collection of talismans and a musical penknife. Plus, Philip Mould meets a tax inspector who was paid in paintings by several artists.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How some of our greatest railways have challenged engineering's finest minds in their efforts to conquer the planet's waterways, including a tunnel beneath the English Channel..

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A little-known dark past explains the vast monolithic structures that dominate the small British island of Guernsey.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Durham Cathedral, where she examines a collection of rare books, including an early version of the Magna Carta, and John Axford examines a rare 19th-century plate. Objects brought in to be valued include a carriage clock found on a bomb site, an early drawing by Laura Knight, a 19th-century missionary's medical kit and a collection of football memorabilia.

programme.title: Ganges
programme.desc: The final leg of the river's journey sees it join its tributary the Brahmaputra. As the waters merge, they overspill their banks to fan out into hundreds of smaller rivulets and create the world's largest delta. The programme reveals how people and wildlife survive the inhospitable habitat, perhaps the last place on Earth where the Bengal tiger is still king.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the hunting tactics of the world's carnivores. Arctic foxes in the frozen north must collect food during warmer times to survive the winter, while the big cats of the southern hemisphere rely on stealth and surprise to catch each meal. The presenter also reveals how leopards and tigers are solitary hunters, coming together only to mate, whereas lions stay in family groups so they can tackle larger prey and better protect their young.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: A look at the planet's most incredible metropolitan railways, and how they help people solve distinctly urban problems. Including a project to upgrade New York's transit system..

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: How Second World War criminal Adolf Eichmann was tracked down to Buenos Aires, Argentina, in 1961.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Projects include a maze of tunnels filled with haunting remains beneath the streets of Paris and a strange formation of domed structures hovering over the waters off Florida.

programme.title: Secrets of the Solar System
programme.desc: A team of scientists launch a probe to touch the sun and make a surprise discovery on the tiny planet Mercury.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates decide on a wager as the parole board gathers, with Blanco odds-on favourite for release. However, the old lag turns down his freedom and leaves Fletcher in danger of losing a small fortune. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber starts work on another O-level course, but wily old cellmate Fletcher can't understand why he doesn't just cheat in the exam. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch tries to ensure that Godber has not blown his chances of early release after he gets into a fight a week before his parole board hearing. Final episode of the classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave almost drowns during a beach landing exercise. Meanwhile, Donna's sister Kelly falls for one of the locals and Major Kieran Voce has divided loyalties over his love life.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy remains in hospital, and his friends are told that he may never recover his sight, while Marsha Stubbs' involvement with a local businessman leads to a brush with the law.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. In an episode originally broadcast live, distraught dad Jeff Clarke holds the Sun Hill stalwarts at gunpoint, prompting a desperate response from Dan Casper - who ends up getting shot, along with the real Gabriel Kent. Fortunately, Terry Perkins is able to stay cool and assume the role of mediator, helping to defuse the situation while Acting Superintendent Amanda Prosser flounders helplessly.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Tricia becomes emotional when her attempts to reunite a dying man with his drug-abusing son are too close to home, and Mark organises a rushed wedding with the ailing nurse. Matt struggles to understand why his patient will not respond to medication, questioning whether Donna administered it correctly, while Chrissie and Kyla argue over the running of the ward.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Chloe finds herself short of cash and is subsequently labelled prime suspect when a patient discovers her purse has gone missing. Meanwhile, a distraught father learns his son has been attacked by football hooligans, Duffy returns from a romantic weekend with her husband and Mel's fear of dogs is exposed. Medical drama, starring Jan Anderson, Robert Gwilym and Cathy Shipton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Adam Okaro returns to Sun Hill, where he resumes his role as Superintendent - and immediately asks Jo Masters to find out how the press obtained a photo of Lesley Palmer. Meanwhile, Smithy and Laura Bryant continue to investigate the real Gabriel Kent's identity - and try to fathom the true nature of his relationship with June Ackland.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Gita is devastated by what she has seen; Michelle has good news; Phil has a proposition for Frank; and when Nadia turns up again, Grant decides to take matters into his own hands.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sanjay is begging Geeta for forgiveness, but will she take him back? and Pat and Frank are having major money troubles when she gets a surprise knock on the door!.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team help a tax driver who has got his arm caught in a drain. Meanwhile, Pitbull appoints a reluctant Recall to represent him at his disciplinary hearing.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: David and Anna have a secret romance, Beth starts to feel paranoid about the amount of time Tom is spending at the factory, and Nathan and Kate both have important decisions to make about their futures. Starring Philip Middlemiss, Lesley Dunlop, Kerrie Taylor, Julian Lewis Jones, Adam Paul Harvey and Jenny Platt.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna and Tom meet with Ozias Harding, a potential investor at the factory, but David is concerned that the stern disciplinarian could be bad news for the business. Meanwhile, Billy has some upsetting news for Sally, and Beth finds herself in danger when she nurses an elderly lady with a 40-year secret. Starring new cast member Brian Capron and guest Thelma Barlow.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey invites an old school friend to stay for a few days, leaving Sharon out in the cold. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie discovers Marlene has been discussing their marital problems with a counsellor, and the subsequent row results in him being thrown out of the house. With the hotel booked up and his car in a pond, Boycie's only option is to sleep on Bryan's caravan floor. Comedy, starring John Challis and Sue Holderness.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy's experiments with camouflage only succeed in frightening innocent passers-by. Brian Wilde stars in Roy Clarke's long-running comedy.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Wesley discovers an old racing car, which Compo, Clegg and Foggy offer to help him transport back to his shed, not reckoning on its condition. Long-running rural comedy, starring Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde, with Gordon Wharmby.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Crime busters Frank Hathaway and Luella Shakespeare investigate the death of a care home worker, sending Sebastian undercover as a care assistant.

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: When building work at an abandoned cottage unearths a child's hidden remains, Jane uncovers other well-kept family secrets. Drama, starring Claire Goose.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra and the team investigate why five years earlier a man seemingly vanished during his morning run and has not been seen since. The alarm was raised when he never made it to work at the construction company belonging to his father-in-law, who has a history of violence, and the detectives' suspicions grow when they realise how much the missing man's wife is scared of her dad. Could he have had something to do with his son-in-law's disappearance? Amanda Redman, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Denis Lawson and Dennis Waterman star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam leads the inquiry into a fire at a cinema, and finds that the last unidentified body bears an uncanny resemblance to a man murdered many years previously. Unfortunately, an interview with the gangster charged with the murder - played in a straight role by comedian Jack Dee - leaves her more confused than she was to begin with. Amanda Burton stars.

programme.title: The Keith & Paddy Picture Show
programme.desc: A festive special in which Keith Lemon and Paddy McGuinness team up to remake Joe Dante's 1984 horror comedy Gremlins. Original star Zach Galligan helps out as they tackle the story of a cute little creature given as a Christmas present, but which spawns a horde of murderous little monsters after an accidental dowsing with water, with appearances by Kara Tointon, John Thomson, Su Pollard, Les Dennis and Arthur Bostrom..

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: The Race for a Cure: Making Britain Safe - Tonight
programme.desc: Ranj Singh looks at the urgent race to find drugs to successfully treat Covid-19. With hopes of defeating the deadly virus lying with the world's scientists - including those working in Britain - Dr Singh gains first-hand access to laboratories and drug trials across the country. He reports on the unprecedented scientific efforts going into developing drugs to treat those in hospital with the virus, as well as the search for a vaccine to inoculate everyone. With the success of these trials determining how soon people can resume normal life and get the economy running as before, the stakes could not be higher.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Warwick Davis invites five school friends from Kent to answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Hannah, Priscilla, Ian and Stephen work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Will fears that he has totally blown it, Lydia speculates about Vinny's new friend and Leyla is shocked when she sees what has happened.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Michael convinces Ed to stand up for himself, James fears that he will never be accepted and Leanne leans on Toyah and Nick for support.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon disapproves of Tracey dating policeman Barry, especially as she appears to be neglecting Garth's feelings about his dear, departed dad, leading to a major argument between the sisters. Can Dorien solve their problems in her new role as a magazine agony aunt? Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Respected surgeon Dan Marsden is shot dead days before his retirement and his teenage daughters Mira and Karen are abducted. Joined by a new addition to the ranks, Vera investigates a mysterious parcel and a connection to the Iraq War as she races against time to catch the killer and save the girls. However, the case soon takes a violent and unexpected turn, striking at the heart of the team. Guest starring Saskia Reeves (Luther) and Dean Andrews (Ashes to Ashes), with Brenda Blethyn, David Leon and Gareth Farr.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Gremlins (1984)
programme.desc: A teenager is given a strange, cute creature as a Christmas present by his eccentric father and warned to keep it away from water, not to feed it after midnight, or expose it to direct light. However, a chance dousing causes the furball to spawn a horde of murderous little monsters, and their devilish antics bring mayhem to a small town. Comedy horror, with Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, Hoyt Axton and Polly Holliday.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories

programme.title: How Do They Do It?

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove visit two amazing sets of sheds in Hampshire, where they find plenty of Japanese bikes - but they come away with a real surprise. Selling their projects on, however, proves to be a challenge.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove are in the heart of Oxfordshire where they find rare Minis, 1970s Rollers and a pristine rally car - but can they get her running and profitable?.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A captain's bet has the boats jockeying for position on the blue grounds, while a returning veteran proves his worth on the red grounds.

programme.desc: Justin gambles thousands of dollars as he struggles over the season. Opal queen Kelly is in desperate need for a big find underground and Aaron and Greg's claim might pay off.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Blackpool, a 1930s church is ready to be buried. Meanwhile, in Sussex the team attempts to resurrect a vintage limousine from the 1980s into a banger racer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to America in search of a Willys Jeep, but the vehicle he finds needs major repairs and high transport costs to the UK could jeopardise his making a profit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini enters a dusty Saab into the Barn Find competition and takes a vintage electric car for a spin.

programme.desc: Wayne Carini helps a man to build a car collection after restoring his Ferrari Lusso.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Elliot Neese sparks a turf war when he breaks the captain's code, while new deckhands make expensive mistakes and may lose their positions.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton recreates a D-Day parachute jump in a genuine Second World War uniform.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard road trips to Cornwall for a major buying mission. In Penzance, he haggles with a hoarder who owns a reclamation yard, before heading to the county's busiest auction house.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Botley, Oxfordshire, a 1960s shopping centre is being pulled apart to make way for a church, library and a community centre. As the demolition, salvage and waste management experts move in, the project is expected to take over three months to complete.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China tries to renovate a Triumph Spitfire sports car so Mike Brewer can sell it for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China continues to renovate the Triumph Spitfire, replacing the differential and rear shock absorbers and having the bumpers and handles chromed.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Rookies' relationship is on the rocks as they battle their biggest claim yet as well as each other. With two partners working at different speeds, there's a fight brewing.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a Devon mansion and takes home the worst chair he has ever bought and, at a lace factory in Scotland, literally goes home with the kitchen sink.

programme.title: Aliens: The Definitive Guide
programme.desc: Part two of two. How mankind should prepare for the possibility of extra-terrestrial visitors, particularly if they happen to have non-peaceful intentions.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: Vast gold resources lie among south east Asia's island rivers, but they are also home to crocodiles, and locals need the help of professional to extract the valuable ore.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The processes involved in using paraffin to make Gouda cheese, the building of powerful Scania trucks, and how the world's biggest DNA database helps to solve crime.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Exploring the creation of classical guitars and fast tractor mowing machines. Plus, how climbers maintain the blades on wind turbines.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: The murders of an elderly North Dakota couple during an attack in their home. Detectives discovered a crime scene hopelessly compromised.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Documentary featuring investigations in which natural clues, including insect bites, cat hair and a rare form of bacteria helped forensic scientists solve murders.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When Diane Cunningham is found murdered, the only clues are several receipts. Security footage reveals a prime suspect, but not everything is quite as it seems.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.sub-title: Roses Are Red, Murder Is Too
programme.desc: The death of a town council member. Local residents were appalled - especially when the evidence began to suggest a professional 'hit' had taken place.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The contribution made by the FBI in tracking down drug-dealing murderer Jeffrey Matthews after the bombing of a Drug Enforcement Agency building.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team checks up on the progress of a group of bears and tigers rescued from a chicken shed.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A desperate owner hopes Lisa can save a cat that has been hit by a car, and Chris battles to save Homer the turtle after a vicious dog bite.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown experiences a difficult week as he treats everything from horses, wombats, monkeys and a mother in trouble.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Amy bought a gown elsewhere, before changing her mind, and now she is hunting for her dream dress, while Michelle views her outfit after losing more than three stone.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: The Big Day
programme.desc: A businesswoman preparing for her wedding has to juggle managing her cosmetics company and living up to her wealthy family's expectations.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Harriet the Bearded Dragon has a worrying lump on the side of her leg that requires an urgent operation, and a sick 10-week-old puppy is put in danger by her protective owner.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A three-day-old kitten with a badly twisted leg needs a series of splints to save her, and female loggerhead turtles are in the midst of laying eggs, and some have begun to hatch.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Rottweilers are seized following a fatal attack on their neighbour's dog and guinea pigs, and the team tries to rescue a kitten trapped in a carcass-strewn junkyard.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: A litter of puppies is struck by the parvo virus, while officers shoot to kill when a cop is attacked by a vicious dog.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Police investigate the death of a man who was found in the driver's seat of his car by a security guard - and suspect he was killed by an illegal hunter.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 21-year-old nursing student Maura Murray, who went missing in February 2004 minutes after being involved in a traffic collision. For no apparent reason she had driven 144 miles north from her campus and the accident was the second road incident she had suffered within two days.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.sub-title: Michele Whitaker: The Last Truck Stop
programme.desc: The disappearance of Michele Whitaker who vanished in August 2002 after hitching a ride from a South Carolina truck stop. Convinced no one would be troubled at her departure, she made a new life on America's west coast, and only contacted relatives after a friend made her aware of a missing persons inquiry in her name six years later.

programme.title: Reasonable Doubt
programme.desc: The case of Ryan Widmer, who despite his protestations of innocence, was convicted of murdering his new wife Sarah in 2008. This documentary revisits the evidence that proved his guilt.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Jackie, who has worn many bridal gowns throughout her modelling career, tries to find the perfect dress for her big day, while Alia returns for her final fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Visiting the bridal salon today are Dale, who has been waiting 30 years for her dream wedding, and Rachael, who wants to find a princess dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Same sex couple Meighan and Christina are looking for gowns that are individually flattering but complement each other. Will they both find their dream dress?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Katherine and Sophie from reality series DC Cupcakes begin their search for Katherine's dream wedding dress, while Suzy and her sister seek an outfit they both love.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: The Devil Is in the Details
programme.desc: Niche wants a fashionable gown but her mother prefers the traditional look, while a bride with a specific style in mind struggles to find her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Too Many Cooks in the Kitchen
programme.desc: Cake Boss Buddy Valastro's wife Lisa searches for the perfect dress for their vow renewal, but she is torn between two gowns.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three rivals set out to bag the best bargains from a sunny French market in the Languedoc, before taking everything to Lincoln to sell on - with whoever makes the most profit winning everyone's cash. Stephen learns the hard way the perils of buying lighting, Lisa shows how to save money when getting things framed, and Alice creates a new shelving unit out of a ladder.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Former model Cathy brings in her collection of designer bags and jewellery, hoping to secure a £50,000 loan to help her launch a lingerie business, while Prestige boss James Constantinou attracts unwanted attention when he goes for a spin in a client's Ferrari. A woman wants to pawn her grandfather's First World War medals to raise money for her mother's funeral, and an inventor decides to part with his precious watch.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A woman who weighs 700 pounds is completely dependent on her husband and lives in constant fear that she will die, so tries to change her diet prior to gastric surgery.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: Detectives, friends and family reveal the twists and turns that led to tragedy, and where it all went wrong - revealing the 10 steps to murder.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: Linda Wittmier and Terry Jo Howard both fell in love with the same man. However, they never realised how lucky they were to survive his twisted sexual desire to kill.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: In 1984, a young woman's body was discovered in a lane close to her home in Bath, England. How did police eventually track down the perpetrator of this heinous attack?.
